articles.headline: Revolutionizing CAR-T Therapy: How Peptide Bonds Are Targeting Cancer's Strongest Defenses
articles.hook: Imagine a future where your immune system can precisely target cancer cells without harming healthy tissue—this research is making it possible.
articles.difficulty:
**Sophomore**: Needs intro-level major courses (organic, biochem, etc.)  
This research integrates organic synthesis, protein structure, and immunology—topics you’re encountering in sophomore-level courses.
articles.source: Journal of the American Chemical Society

articles.headline: Revolutionizing CAR-T Therapy: How Disulfide Bonds Target Solid Tumors
articles.hook: Imagine a future where your immune system can precisely target cancer cells without harming healthy tissue—this research is making it possible.
articles.difficulty: **SOPHOMORE**: Needs intro-level major courses (organic, biochem, etc.) to grasp peptide synthesis, bonding principles, and protein structure.
articles.source: Journal of the American Chemical Society

articles.headline: Revolutionizing Cancer Treatments: Peptides That Stick Around to Fight Solid Tumors
articles.hook: If you’re studying biochemistry or immunology, this could be the next big breakthrough in cancer treatment—using chemistry to make CAR-T cells smarter and more effective.
articles.source: Journal of the American Chemical Society

articles.headline: Revolutionizing Cancer Treatment: How Peptide Rings Outsmart Solid Tumors
articles.hook: If you’ve ever wondered how scientists make CAR-T cells smarter, this breakthrough could be the key to fighting stubborn solid tumors—without harming healthy tissue.
articles.source: Journal of the American Chemical Society

articles.headline: Revolutionizing Cancer Treatment: How Peptide Bonds Are Shaping the Future of CAR-T Therapy
articles.hook: Imagine a future where your biology class concepts could revolutionize cancer treatment—this research is proof that your studies are already shaping tomorrow’s breakthroughs.
articles.difficulty: **SOPHOMORE**: Needs intro-level major courses (organic, biochem, etc.)—this research blends concepts from all three.
articles.source: Journal of the American Chemical Society

articles.headline: Revolutionizing Cancer Treatment: How Disulfide Bonds Are Shaping the Future of CAR-T Therapy
articles.hook: If you're studying biochemistry or molecular biology, this breakthrough could redefine how you approach drug design—and how you think about the future of personalized medicine.
articles.difficulty:
**Sophomore**: Needs intro-level major courses (organic, biochem, etc.)  
This research ties together concepts from organic chemistry (peptide synthesis), biochemistry (protein structure), and computational methods—all foundational for sophomores in STEM fields.
articles.source: Journal of the American Chemical Society
